intro: Osteospermum hispidum, commonly known as the woolly osteospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fuzzy, hairy leaves and showy yellow-centered daisy-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its compact growth habit and vibrant blooms make it an attractive ornamental plant.
